wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core

Class ImageCoreIJ

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.resource.generic.ResourceCoreGeneric
      • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.ImageCoreIJ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceCore, ImageCore
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageCoreGray8IJ

    public class ImageCoreIJ
extends ResourceCoreGeneric
implements ImageCore
    The ImageCore class is a wrapper for the ImageJ library's image data and its basic operations. The class does not expose all functionalities of ImagePlus, but rather a selection of fundamental operations.
    Author:
    Remy Malgoures

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageCoreIJ

        public ImageCoreIJ(java.lang.String path,
                   boolean format_8bits,
                   boolean maximizeValuesRange)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs an instance by loading the image from a source file with default calibration value. The voxel's edges lengths are all set to 1.0. The predefined metadata for the resource of type ImageCore is created with the MetaDataRetriever.RetrievalPolicy.TryConfFileNoDialog policy.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the image source file on disk.
        format_8bits - true if the image should be converted () if necessary to 8 bits per pixels and memory should be optimized for this.
        maximizeValuesRange - If true, then the gray levels will be scaled so as to occupy the broadest possible range in the image representation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException in case of failure to load the image from file

      • ImageCoreIJ

        public ImageCoreIJ(java.lang.String path,
                   boolean format_8bits,
                   boolean maximizeValuesRange,
                   MetaDataRetriever.RetrievalPolicy retrievalPolicy)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs an instance by loading the image from a source file with default calibration value. The voxel's edges lengths are all set to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        path - path to the image source file on disk.
        format_8bits - true if the image should be converted (if necessary) to 8 bits per pixels and memory should be optimized for this.
        maximizeValuesRange - If true, then the gray levels will be scaled so as to occupy the broadest possible range in the image representation.
        retrievalPolicy - The policy to retrieve predefined metadata for the resource of type ImageCore.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException in case of failure to load the image from file
        See Also:
        MetaDataRetriever.RetrievalPolicy, ImageContrast.maximizeValuesRange()

        public ImageCoreIJ(ImageCoreIJ image)
        Constructs a full copy of this instance.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to copy.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException in case of failure to load the image from file

      • ImageCoreIJ

        public ImageCoreIJ(ij.ImagePlus imp)
        The method is provided to make compatibility with legacy code using ImageJ easier. Note that the purpose of this class is to wrap and hide the ImageJ library. The use of this method should therefore always be considered transitional, unless intended for private use.
        Parameters:
        imp - Image data as an ImageJ image Instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException in case of failure to load the image from file

      • getEmptyImageCore

        public static ImageCoreIJ getEmptyImageCore(int width,
                                            int height,
                                            int depth,
                                            int bitDepth)
        Allocates and returns a black image with given dimensions and type (GRAY8 or GRAY16). The gray levels are uninitialized, the image has a default title and no meatdata such as calibration data.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the image in the first voxel coordinate
        height - Height of the image in the second voxel coordinate
        depth - Depth of the image in the third voxel coordinate
        bitDepth - Number of bits per voxel
        Returns:
        An instance of ImageCore implementer
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getImageCalibration(), ModelCoreGeneric.addMetaData(wrapScienceJ.metaData.container.MetaDataRetriever)

        public ij.ImagePlus getImp()

Note that the purpose of this class is to wrap and hide the ImageJ library. The use of this method should therefore always be considered transitional.

      • getWhiteValue

        public int getWhiteValue()
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Allows to retrieve the maximage gray level given an image representation. This is 255 for a one byte per component (e.g.GRAY8) and 65535 for a 2 bytes per component (e.g. GRAY16)
        Specified by:
        getWhiteValue in interface ImageCore
        Returns:

        See Also:
        ImageCore.getWhiteValue()

      • setCurrentZ

        public void setCurrentZ(int zCoord)
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Sets the z-value of the current slice (for use with ImageCore.getPixel(int, int)) and ImageCore.setPixel(int, int, int). For cache optimization reasons, z-values should not be access randomly, but the slices should better be processed one by one. For the reason, changing the z value, which is set at each new slice accessed, is a relatively expensive operationand can be made explicit.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentZ in interface ImageCore
        Parameters:
        zCoord - the id (z-value) of the new current slice, between zero and (getDepth()-1).
        See Also:
        ImageCore.setCurrentZ(int)

      • getCurrentZ

        public int getCurrentZ()
        Specified by:
        getCurrentZ in interface ImageCore
        Returns:
        the z-value of the current slice, between zero and (getDepth()-1).
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getCurrentZ()

      • setVoxel

        public void setVoxel(int x,
                     int y,
                     int z,
                     int value)
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Sets the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. The method checks of the z-value (slice id) has changed with respect to the previous access, and in that case updates the z-value (ImageCore.setCurrentZ(int). Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one.
        Specified by:
        setVoxel in interface ImageCore
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        z - the (integer valued) z coordinate of the pixel
        value - the gray level value to set for the pixel.
        See Also:
        ImageCore.setVoxel(int, int, int, int)

      • setVoxelFloat

        public void setVoxelFloat(int x,
                          int y,
                          int z,
                          float floatValue)
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Sets the gray level value of a voxel on the current stack of the image. The method checks of the z-value (slice id) has changed with respect to the previous access, and in that case updates the z-value (ImageCore.setCurrentZ(int). Note that accessing z-values (different slices) randomly is expensive and that slices should rather be processed one by one. This method should be used exclusively for methods intended to work with image with floating point representation of gray levels.
        Specified by:
        setVoxelFloat in interface ImageCore
        Parameters:
        x - the (integer valued) x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the (integer valued) y coordinate of the pixel
        z - the (integer valued) z coordinate of the pixel
        floatValue - the gray level value to set for the pixel.
        See Also:
        ImageCore.setVoxelFloat(int, int, int, float)

      • getImageSignPolicyEmbed

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageSignPolicyEmbed(boolean allowSignedValues)
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Factory to generate an instance allowing to perform linear combinations with other images, or similar operations such as set constant values. There are mainly two policies to perform these operations: with signed values or with unsigned values. Due to unsupported unsigned values in java, the implementation of some operations differs depending on the policy, thus leading to two derived classes. Note that no change in the values is made at instantiation. Only some operations such as absolute values and subtraction have a different implementation with the unsigned and signed policies. THE USER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR RELEVANT INPUT IMAGE FORMAT FOR SIGNED/UNSIGNED VALUES. Use ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) if necessary to ensure this precondition.
        Specified by:
        getImageSignPolicyEmbed in interface ImageCore
        Parameters:
        allowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels MUST BE arranged to start in the middle of the range of a short value, in order to support signed operations.
        Returns:
        The instance of the relevant linear combinations implementer
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getImageSignPolicyEmbed(boolean)

      • getImageSignPolicyEmbed

        public ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric getImageSignPolicyEmbed()
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Factory to generate an instance allowing to perform linear combinations with other images, or similar operations such as set constant values. This method is the default for ImageCore.getImageSignPolicyEmbed(boolean) which provides the UNSIGNED POLICY (allowSignedValues = false) There are mainly two policies to perform these operations: with signed values or with unsigned values. Due to unsupported unsigned values in java, the implementation of some operations differs depending on the policy, thus leading to two derived classes.
        Specified by:
        getImageSignPolicyEmbed in interface ImageCore
        Returns:
        The instance of the relevant linear combinations implementer
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getImageSignPolicyEmbed()

      • getImageDifferential

        public ImageDifferentialOperatorGeneric getImageDifferential(boolean autoAllowSignedValues,
                                                             int inputImageMarginX,
                                                             int inputImageMarginY,
                                                             int inputImageMarginZ,
                                                             BufferEnlargementPolicy enlargementPolicy,
                                                             int embedBitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing general convolution Operators (e.g. Blur, Gradient, Laplacian, Partial Differentials...) for this image. The operators can be composed using the Cascade Design Pattern.
        Specified by:
        getImageDifferential in interface ImageCore
        Parameters:
        autoAllowSignedValues - If true, the gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value.
        inputImageMarginX - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in X
        inputImageMarginY - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in Y
        inputImageMarginZ - Margin breadth to enlarge the input image in Z
        enlargementPolicy - Policy to fill the new margins with color
        embedBitDepth - The target bit depth for the image to be embedded using the method ImageSignPolicyEmbedGeneric.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int) thus allowing values to be added AND subtracted without overflow. Otherwise, the image is assumed to already allow values to be added AND subtracted without overflow.
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageDifferential interface for this image
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getImageDifferential(boolean, int, int, int, wrapScienceJ.resource.BufferEnlargementPolicy, int)

      • getImageDifferential

        public ImageDifferentialOperatorGeneric getImageDifferential()
        Description copied from interface: ImageCore
        Retrieves an instance of the class implementing general convolution Operators (e.g. Blur, Gradient, Laplacian, Partial Differentials...) for this image. The operators can be composed using the Cascade Design Pattern. The output image is automatically embedded using ImageSignPolicyEmbed.getImageEmbedding(boolean, int). The gray levels are shifted to start in the middle of the range of a short value (same as ImageCore.getImageDifferential(boolean, int, int, int, BufferEnlargementPolicy, int) with autoAllowSignedValues=true).
        Specified by:
        getImageDifferential in interface ImageCore
        Returns:
        an instance of the class implementing the ImageDifferential interface for this image
        See Also:
        ImageCore.getImageDifferential()
